title: Jimmy Carr: Comedy made my whole life better
description: The comedian says learning techniques such as timing and communication impacted all areas of his life.

title: How the semiconductor shortage could be a problem for you
description: Intel is making an effort to combat the global semiconductor shortage at their new site in Arizona.

title: Booksellers hope soaring sales will continue as we read more
description: We have been buying more books since the start of the pandemic as lockdowns created more time to read.

title: Lionel Messi: The inside story of Paris St-Germain forward's first months in France
description: Lionel Messi spent 21 years at Barcelona. BBC Sport's Guillem Balague reports on his first two months with new club Paris St-Germain.

title: Nigeria’s #EndSars protests: What did they achieve?
description: A year after the massive #EndSars protests many complain that police brutality remains a problem.

title: Ros Atkins On... China's climate change promises
description: Ahead of COP26, Ros Atkins looks at what the world's biggest emitters are doing to tackle climate change.

title: Sepsis survivor uses wrestling for rehabilitation
description: David Wellington from Bristol is using Olympic wrestling to help him adapt to life after sepsis.

title: Life at 50C: Keeping cool in India's heatwaves
description: One charity is helping the country's poor stay cool with a simple and cheap solution.

title: Ivermectin: How false science created a Covid 'miracle' drug
description: Thousands worldwide have taken ivermectin to fight Covid. But what's the evidence?

title: Civil partnership: Call for same sex affairs to be grounds for split
description: Woman explains why it was difficult to end her civil partnership despite her wife's affair.

title: Boris Johnson: It is our mission as Tories to promote opportunity
description: Boris Johnson tells his party conference that better housing and transport will "level up" society.

title: American rivals DeChambeau and Koepka to go head-to-head
description: Americans Bryson DeChambeau and Brooks Koepka will renew their rivalry when they go head-to-head in The Match in Las Vegas.

title: Why are some footballers vaccine hesitant & what happens next?
description: With the Premier League, club managers, politicians and football authorities all encouraging vaccinations, why are some players still hesitant - and what can be done?

title: China-Taiwan military tensions 'worst in 40 years'
description: Taiwan's defence minister warns of the risk of an accidental strike amid more Chinese aerial incursions.

title: Pig cull threat not being taken seriously by PM, says vet
description: A labour shortage in abattoirs means some 600 pigs have already been shot and discarded.

title: Tesco shrugs off supply concerns as sales surge
description: Britain's biggest supermarket shrugs off the impact of the pandemic and supply chain crisis.

title: Universal credit: Tory peer issues fresh call for vote on benefit uplift end
description: The £20-a-week top-up to universal credit was always meant to be temporary, the government says.

title: England hold positive Ashes talks with Cricket Australia
description: England hold positive talks with Cricket Australia as they seek to move a step closer to confirming the Ashes can go ahead as planned.

title: Tewkesbury stabbings: Man dies as three attacked
description: A man is arrested after a knifeman attacks people on a Tewkesbury housing estate in Gloucestershire.

title: Covid symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms of coronavirus.

title: Conservative conference: Dominic Raab criticised for misogyny comments
description: Critics accuse the justice secretary of not understanding the definition of violence against women.

title: Chemistry Nobel awarded for mirror-image molecules
description: A Briton and a German have been awarded the chemistry Nobel for their work to build new molecules.

title: Supreme Court upholds challenge to two Holyrood bills
description: Two bills passed by MSPs will have to be amended after the Supreme Court upheld a challenge made by UK law officers.

title: Blood on the bars: Lizzie Deignan's Paris-Roubaix win & a landmark for women's cycling
description: There was blood on the handlebars, mud everywhere else. Lizzie Deignan looks back on her glorious win in a landmark race for women's cycling.

title: Sarah Everard: Labour peer to demand fuller Met inquiry
description: Shami Chakrabati says the inquiry into failings after Sarah Everard's murder needs to be judge-led.

title: Universal credit reduction: 'I feel overwhelmed' at financial impact
description: As the £20-a-week UC uplift is withdrawn, we ask three women how it will affect them.

title: Overseas workers only way to solve shortages, says Next boss
description: Next boss Lord Wolfson says hiring overseas workers under a visa tax scheme is the solution to shortages.

title: The Papers: PM has 'guts to fix UK' amid battle with business
description: Previews of Boris Johnson's conference speech and rows with industry over shortages lead the papers.

title: Let's pay together? Tina sells song rights for reported $50m
description: The star hands over the rights to songs like The Best and Nutbush City Limits to music company BMG.

title: 'It would be amazing to win this after the Euros' - all you need to know about Nations League finals
description: Find out who is playing in the 2021 Nations League finals and read what the tournament is all about.

title: Why are woodlands being snapped up in Wales?
description: A couple and a family explain why they decided to spend their savings on a woodland in Wales.

title: You have to embarrass the racists - Holding
description: West Indies great Michael Holding says people must "call out" and "embarrass" racists if equality is to be achieved.

title: Rare drawings by boxing great Muhammad Ali sell for nearly $1m
description: Some 26 drawings, sketches and paintings by the legendary boxer went under the hammer in New York.

title: Study reveals why some people get Covid toe condition
description: Scientists have investigated how the chilblain-like lesions arise in some people who catch Covid.
